summary: The 'Cooper Davis and Devin Norring Act' amends the Controlled Substances Act to require electronic communication service providers and remote computing services to report to the Attorney General certain controlled substances violations.  It defines key terms, outlines reporting requirements for various drug-related crimes (fentanyl, methamphetamine, counterfeit substances, and unauthorized prescription medications), specifies report contents, grants the Attorney General investigative powers, imposes penalties for non-compliance, clarifies privacy protections, and mandates an annual report on these activities. Several conforming amendments are made to related laws.
